data: {"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"belongs_to_collection":null,"budget":0,"genres":[{"id":878,"name":"Science Fiction"},{"id":27,"name":"Horror"}],"homepage":"","id":1182169,"imdb_id":null,"origin_country":["GB"],"original_language":"en","original_title":"Smoker of the Future","overview":"This anti-smoking public information film has the kind of stylistic sheen often associated with 1980s British advertising, with its sci-fi setting, filtered smoke and gloomy aesthetics clearly inspired by the works of Ridley Scott (although it’s directed by his contemporary, Barry Myers).  It imagines a genetically advanced future humanoid who’s evolved to be a ‘natural born smoker’ – complete with enlarged nostrils and tapping finger - before reminding us that no such creature yet exists. While we expect smoking adverts to be disturbing, the titular character is disquieting in a refreshingly unusual sense.","popularity":0.881,"poster_path":"/utGU2zFm8VE9zuicAcbkdTQzntn.jpg","production_companies":[{"id":209328,"logo_path":null,"name":"Spots Films","origin_country":""}],"production_countries":[{"iso_3166_1":"GB","name":"United Kingdom"}],"release_date":"1985-01-01","revenue":0,"runtime":1,"spoken_languages":[{"english_name":"English","iso_639_1":"en","name":"English"}],"status":"Released","tagline":"","title":"Smoker of the Future","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0}
